essentials.name: basic support
essentials.overview: basic support provided by UIKit and Xcode
essentials.required_resources: App icons and Launch screen storyboard are required
essentials.required_app_metadata: Info.plist: System gains info about your app configuration and capability through Info.plist in your app bundle.
essentials.code_structure_of_uikit_app: Structure is based on Model-View-Controller (MVC) design pattern where objects are divided by purpose. 'Model': objects that manage the app's data and logic. 'View': category contains objects that provide visual representation of your data. 'Controller': Objects acting as a bridge between your apps model and view objects, moving data between them at appropriate times.

essentials.name: protect user privacy
essentials.overview: secure personal data and user preference on data use
essentials.request_data_when_needed: request access to user or device data.
essentials.transparent_use_of_data: provide app store with url for your privacy policy
essentials.control_over_data: provide settings allowing user to disable access to information. Use strongest data protection level for your situation when storing files. If using ASIdentifierManager class respect value of its isAdertisingTrackingEnabled property. If user sets property to false then use ASIdentifierManager class only for limited advertising purposes

app_structure.name: app and environment
app_structure.description: apps life-cycle events, UI scenes, traits and environment
app_structure.overview: multiple instances of your app. Consult trait collection of UIView or UIViewController object to customize contents. Adopt UITraitEnvironment protocol in other objects that you want to receive trait notification changes.

viewcontrollers.overview: defines the shared behavior that is common to all view controllers.
viewcontrollers.subclassing_notes: Each app contains minimum of one custom subclass of UIViewController. More often, apps contain many custom view controllers.

viewcontrollers.overview: Subclass UITableViewController when your interface consists of a table view and little or no other content.
viewcontrollers.subclassing_notes: Each app contains minimum of one custom subclass of UIViewController. More often, apps contain many custom view controllers.

viewcontrollers.overview: A view controller implements the following behavior:
viewcontrollers.subclassing_notes: Each app contains minimum of one custom subclass of UIViewController. More often, apps contain many custom view controllers.

views.overview: Views are the fundamental building blocks of your app's user interface, and the UIView class defines the behaviors that are common to all views. A view object renders content within its bounds rectangle, and handles any interactions with that content.
views.subclassing_notes: Each app contains minimum of one custom subclass of UIViewController. More often, apps contain many custom view controllers.
